properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 12 at 9:10AM EDT by NWS Binghamton NY
properties.description:
At 909 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over
Tompkinsville, or near Waverly, moving northeast at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around
unsecured objects.

Locations impacted include...
Clifford, Forest City, Vandling, Union Dale, East Benton, Pleasant
Mount, Tompkinsville, Fleetville, Lenoxville, and Royal.

This includes the following highway exits...
Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 197 and 206.
properties.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel
clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions
they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a
funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the
National Weather Service.

NWSheadline: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SUSQUEHANNA... NORTHEASTERN LACKAWANNA AND WEST CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTIES THROUGH 945 AM EDT

properties.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 5:50AM EDT until April 13 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh PA has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in West Virginia...Ohio...
Pennsylvania...

Ohio River At Moundsville affecting Marshall County.

Ohio River At Wheeling affecting Ohio and Belmont Counties.

Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County.

Ohio River At Powhatan Point affecting Marshall, Monroe and
Belmont Counties.

Ohio River At Pike Island affecting Ohio, Jefferson OH and
Belmont Counties.

Ohio River At Hannibal affecting Wetzel, Monroe and Tyler
Counties.

Ohio River At Montgomery affecting Columbiana, Hancock and Beaver
Counties.

.An intense storm system moving up the Ohio Valley has produced
widespread moderate to heavy rain to our area. Rainfall amounts
across southwest Pennsylvania and the northern panhandle of West
Virginia range from 1.25

This heavy rain is resulting in significant runoff that is causing
rivers to rise rapidly. On the Ohio river, many locations are
forecast to reach or exceed minor flood stage.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh.

* WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow evening.

* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela
Parking Wharf.
At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk
between the stadiums.
At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded.
At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower areas of
the North Shore Riverwalk.
At 22.0 feet, The Tenth Street Bypass floods.
At 22.5 feet, The fountain plaza is flooded.
At 24.0 feet, Water enters the outer pool of the fountain.
At 24.9 feet, Water entes the inner pool of the fountain.
At 25.0 feet, The Parkway Central (also known as the bathtub) is
closed by flooding. Lower North Side businesses are affected.
At 26.0 feet, State Correctional Institution Pittsburgh is impacted.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 5:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 20.2 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage
late this evening to a crest of 25.2 feet just after midnight
tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow
afternoon.
- Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
25.3 feet on 12/02/2010.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.

The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM EDT.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY

properties.description:

Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...

Allegheny River At CW Bill Young Dam affecting Allegheny County.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Allegheny River at CW Bill Young Dam.

* WHEN...From this afternoon to early Sunday morning.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 3:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 15.0 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage
late this afternoon to a crest of 17.5 feet tomorrow morning.
It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening.
- Flood stage is 17.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of

NWSheadline: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING

properties.areaDesc: Geauga; Ashtabula Inland; Ashtabula Lakeshore; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Crawford
properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 12 at 3:33AM EDT until April 13 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
properties.description:
* WHAT...West winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 50 mph
expected.

* WHERE...Geauga and Ashtabula Counties in Ohio. Erie and Crawford
Counties in Pennsylvania.

* WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 5 AM EDT Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.
Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
result.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 AM EDT SATURDAY

properties.areaDesc: Armstrong, PA; Butler, PA; Clarion, PA; Forest, PA; Lawrence, PA; Mercer, PA; Venango, PA
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 12:43AM EDT until April 12 at 9:45AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.

* WHERE...Portions of northwest, west central, and western
Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in northwest
Pennsylvania, western Forest, Mercer and Venango. In west central
Pennsylvania, central Armstrong, Butler and Clarion. In western
Pennsylvania, Lawrence.

* WHEN...Until 945 AM EDT Friday.

* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying
and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads
remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to
excess runoff from earlier rainfall.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 1239 AM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in
the warned area. Flooding is ongoing. Between 1.5 and 2
inches of rain have fallen.
- The heaviest rain has ended, though runoff from the recent
rain will continue to result in flooding. Additional rainfall
amounts are expected to be a quarter of an inch or less.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include...
New Castle, Hermitage, Butler, Oil City, Grove City,
Franklin, Clarion, Kittanning, Knox, Rimersburg, Homeacre-
Lyndora, Greenville, Sugarcreek, Shanor-Northvue, Meridian,
Slippery Rock, Meadowood, New Wilmington, Oakwood and New
Bethlehem.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EDT THIS MORNING

properties.areaDesc: Belmont, OH; Columbiana, OH; Jefferson, OH; Monroe, OH; Allegheny, PA; Armstrong, PA; Beaver, PA; Butler, PA; Fayette, PA; Greene, PA; Indiana, PA; Lawrence, PA; Washington, PA; Westmoreland, PA; Brooke, WV; Hancock, WV; Marion, WV; Marshall, WV; Monongalia, WV; Ohio, WV; Preston, WV; Wetzel, WV
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 12:36AM EDT until April 12 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.

* WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following
counties, eastern Belmont, southeastern Columbiana, Jefferson OH
and eastern Monroe, Pennsylvania, including the following
counties, Allegheny, southern Armstrong, Beaver, southern Butler,
Fayette, Greene, west central Indiana, southern Lawrence,
Washington and western Westmoreland, and West Virginia, including
the following counties, Brooke, Hancock, Marion, Marshall,
Monongalia, Ohio, north central Preston and Wetzel.

* WHEN...Until 1230 PM EDT Friday.

* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying
and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads
remain closed due to flooding.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 1233 AM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain and
flooding in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing. Between 1.5
and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen.
- The heavy rain has ended, with light showers expected through
early Friday morning. Additional rainfall amounts should be a
quarter of an inch or less.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross
Township, Morgantown, Wheeling, McCandless Township,
Monroeville, Cranberry, Moon Township, McMurray, Greensburg,
Weirton, McKeesport, Fairmont, Steubenville, Butler,
Washington and Franklin Park.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON

properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 11 at 10:51PM EDT until April 15 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in
Pennsylvania...

Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County.

.A strong storm system is moving across the Ohio River Valley,
spreading moderate to heavy rainfall over the region.

Runoff from this rain will be sufficient to cause the Ohio River at
the Point in Pittsburgh to rise above 18.0 feet and begin flooding
the Monongahela River Parking Wharf, reaching 22 feet Friday night
flooding the Tenth Street Bypass.

* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.

* WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh.

* WHEN...Until Monday evening.

* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela
Parking Wharf.
At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk
between the stadiums.
At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded.
At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower areas of
the North Shore Riverwalk.
At 22.0 feet, The Tenth Street Bypass floods.
At 22.5 feet, The fountain plaza is flooded.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 10:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 17.9 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise above 18 feet
tonight, and continue to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet early
Saturday morning. The river should fall below 18 feet by
Monday evening.
- Action stage is 18.0 feet.
- Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an
alternative route.

Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.

Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.

The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at noon EDT.

NWSheadline: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING

title: Current watches, warnings, and advisories for Pennsylvania
